title: ESG exclusive 'club' puts pressure on agriculture - AgUpdate
summary: The article discusses the impact of Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) factors on agricultural producers, highlighting both the potential benefits and threats posed by ESG standards to farming practices and financial opportunities. It outlines how ESG scores, influenced by subjective criteria, can affect farmers' access to capital and compliance with environmental standards, urging them to integrate technology and monitor their environmental footprint. Furthermore, it warns about the increasing scrutiny of the agricultural sector by ESG regulations and the potential for significant market changes based on these evolving standards.
green_innovation: TRUE, because it discusses how agricultural producers are pressured to adopt environmentally sustainable practices and technologies in response to ESG criteria, which aims to mitigate environmental impacts.
business_innovation: TRUE, because the article describes how agricultural businesses must innovate their practices and processes in response to changing financial and market dynamics driven by ESG measures.
green_product: FALSE, because the article does not specifically mention any particular product designed to significantly reduce environmental impact.
green_process: TRUE, because it discusses the need for farmers to adopt sustainable farming practices and technologies that minimize environmental impact, such as reduced chemical usage and improved resource management.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 111 - Crop Production, 112 - Animal Production, 541 - Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services, 54161 - Management Consulting Services
greenwashing: FALSE, because the article primarily describes the realities and impacts of ESG practices on agriculture without making misleading claims about environmental benefits.

title: Koch Engineered Solutions and Percepto Join Forces To Bring - CSRwire.com
summary: Koch Engineered Solutions and Percepto have partnered to leverage AI and autonomous drone technology for the monitoring and reduction of emissions in industrial settings. This collaboration aims to provide cutting-edge inspection services that minimize downtime, streamline compliance, reduce operational costs, and improve safety. The partnership is seen as a significant step toward enhancing customer service and achieving environmental goals through advanced technology. Both companies recognize the mutual benefits and value creation opportunities presented by this relationship.
green_innovation: TRUE - This innovation helps industrial customers monitor and reduce emissions, contributing to environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE - The partnership introduces new and improved services through the integration of AI and drone technology, which differs significantly from previous offerings.
green_product: FALSE - The article does not explicitly describe a specific good but emphasizes partnership services rather than a standalone green product.
green_process: TRUE - The use of AI-powered autonomous drones for emissions monitoring qualifies as a green process as it minimizes environmental impacts and promotes sustainability.
product_or_process: Percepto Air Max and Percepto Air Max OGI platforms
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 541715 - Research and Development in the Physical, Engineering, and Life Sciences, 334511 - Search, Detection, Navigation, Guidance, Aeronautical, and Nautical System and Instrument Manufacturing, 541613 - Marketing Consulting Services, 713990 - All Other Amusement and Recreation Industries
greenwashing: FALSE - The article promotes genuine green innovation and collaboration without making false or misleading claims about environmental benefits.

title: ADM invests over $30m in new facility in Spain to meet growing demand for probiotics - FeedNavigator.com
summary: ADM has invested over $30 million to build a facility that increases its production capacity for probiotics and postbiotics to 50 metric tons annually. This facility aims to meet the growing demand for science-based probiotic formulas used in various applications, including food and dietary supplements. Additionally, ADM emphasizes its commitment to animal nutrition by focusing on the gut microbiome's role in enhancing animal resilience against stressors. The facility will be located near its R&D center, which conducts advanced research in microbiology.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the production of probiotics and postbiotics through innovative manufacturing processes can contribute to environmental sustainability by promoting health and wellness while potentially reducing reliance on antibiotics and harmful substances.
business_innovation: TRUE, because the establishment of a new production facility that significantly increases production capacity and targets a growing market for health supplements represents a new business process for ADM.
green_product: TRUE, because probiotics and postbiotics can be classified as green products designed to enhance health with potentially lower environmental impacts compared to traditional methods of animal and human nutrition.
green_process: TRUE, because the processes involved in producing probiotics and postbiotics aim to minimize environmental impacts and may utilize sustainable production methods.

greenwashing: FALSE, as the article does not present misleading information regarding the environmental benefits of the products or processes. Instead, it genuinely focuses on advancements in sustainable health and wellness through probiotics and postbiotics.

title: Krill diet fulfills choline requirements and supports better intestinal and liver health in salmon - Aquafeed.com
summary: A study conducted by Aker BioMarine and the Norwegian University of Life Sciences evaluated the effect of phosphatidylcholine from krill meal and oil on reducing intestinal steatosis in farmed Atlantic salmon. The findings indicated that both krill meal and oil effectively reduced fat accumulation in the salmon intestine and liver, promoting better health and growth. The research demonstrated that these krill-based ingredients could significantly improve the nutritional quality of fish feed, leading to enhanced product quality.
green_innovation: TRUE - The study contributes to environmental sustainability by using krill meal and oil as functional ingredients that enhance the health and growth of farmed fish, potentially leading to more sustainable aquaculture practices.
business_innovation: TRUE - The study presents a new application of krill-derived ingredients in fish feed, significantly improving growth and health in farmed salmon, thus representing a new or improved product in the business process.
green_product: TRUE - Krill meal and krill oil qualify as green products since they are designed to promote fish health while potentially reducing the environmental impacts associated with fish farming.
green_process: FALSE - While the study references methods for utilizing krill meal and oil, it does not specifically detail any processes that minimize environmental impacts in production or operations.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 311119 - Other Animal Food Manufacturing, 112511 - Finfish Farming and Fish Hatcheries, 325314 -biological product manufacturing, 423850 - Service Establishment Equipment and Supplies Merchant Wholesalers
greenwashing: FALSE - There is no evidence of greenwashing in the article; it provides substantiated research on the environmental benefits and nutritional improvements of using krill-based ingredients in fish feed.

title: MSD Animal Health set to launch revamped platform to predict poultry health, prevent disease and improve performance - FeedNavigator.com
summary: MSD Animal Health will launch the SenseHub Poultry platform in the UK, Brazil, and US poultry markets in Q3 2023. This technology uses wireless sensors to monitor health and environmental indicators within the poultry barns, helping farmers improve bird health and operational efficiency. The platform is designed to provide real-time data and insights to optimize poultry well-being and detect diseases early. Development feedback ensured the platform meets the diverse needs of poultry farmers worldwide.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the SenseHub Poultry platform enhances animal well-being and reduces environmental impacts by monitoring health indicators and improving operational efficiency in poultry farming.
business_innovation: TRUE, as the SenseHub Poultry represents a new business process and product enhancement that differs significantly from existing offerings of MSD Animal Health.
green_product: FALSE, because while it contributes to environmental sustainability, it is primarily a tech solution rather than a tangible good designed for consumer use.
green_process: TRUE, as the platform utilizes sensor technology and real-time data analytics to minimize environmental impacts and enhance sustainable farming practices.

title: Top 20 Most Promising Biotechnology Companies In India 2023 - Inventiva
summary: The article discusses the top 20 biotechnology companies in India for 2023, highlighting their contributions to various sectors including vaccines, biopharmaceuticals, and medical devices. These companies are at the forefront of the biotech industry in India, maintaining a significant presence both domestically and globally. Their investments in research, innovation, and commercialization are transforming the healthcare landscape. The article emphasizes the importance of these companies in addressing healthcare challenges and promoting sustainable practices.

green_product: FALSE: While the companies produce products that may have health benefits, they are not explicitly identified as green products that significantly reduce environmental impacts throughout their life cycle.
